sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"week-3---threads"}}>{`Week 3 - Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"processes-and-threads"}}>{`Processes and Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Processes have two characteristics:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Resource Ownership `}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`process includes a virtual address space to hold the process image `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`the OS performs a protection function to prevent unwanted interference between processes with respect to resources`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Scheduling/Execution`}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`follows an execution path that may be interleaved with other processes `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`a process has an execution state (Running, Ready, etc.) and a dispatching priority and is scheduled and dispatched by the OS`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`These two characteristics are treated independently by modern operating systems:
- the unit of dispatching is referred to as a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`thread`}</MDXTag>{` or lightweight process
- the unit of resource ownership is referred to as a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`process`}</MDXTag>{` or `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`task`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"multithreading"}}>{`Multithreading`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The ability of an OS to support multiple, concurrect paths of execution within a single process`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"process"}}>{`Process`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The unit of resource allocation and a unit of protection.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`A process is associated with: `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`A virtual address space which holds the process image `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Protected access to
- Processors
- Other processes
- Files
- I/O resources `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"multiple-threads-in-process"}}>{`Multiple threads in Process`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Each thread has:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Access to the memory and resources of its process (all threads of a process share this)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`An execution state (running, ready, etc.)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Saved thread context when not running `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`An execution stack `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Some per-thread static storage for local variables`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"single-threaded-vs-multi-threaded"}}>{`Single-Threaded vs multi threaded`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Both have `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`Process Control Block`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Both have `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`User Address Space`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Single thread has a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`User Stack`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`Kernel Stack`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Multithread process has a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`User Stack`}</MDXTag>{`, `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`Kernel Stack`}</MDXTag>{`, `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`Thread Control Block`}</MDXTag>{` within each thread`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"threads"}}>{`Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`In OS that supports threads: scheduling and dispatching done on thread basis `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Most of the state info dealing with execution is maintained in thread-level data structures `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Several actions that affect all of the threads in a process and that the OS must manage at the process level
- Suspending process means all threads of a process
- Terminates a process terminates all threads within the process `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Similar to processes, threads have execution states and may synchronize with one another.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"thread-execution-states"}}>{`Thread Execution States`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Three basic states`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Running `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Ready `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Blocked `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Operations associated with a change in thread state `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Spawn (another thread)
- allocate register context and stacks `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Block
- move to an event queue waiting for the event
- issue: will blocking a thread block other, or all, threads within the same process?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Unblock
- moved the the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`Ready`}</MDXTag>{` queue for execution`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Finish (thread)
- de-allocate register context and stacks `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"thread-synchronization"}}>{`Thread Synchronization`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Necessity to sync activities of all threads and prevent interference between each other.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`all threads of a process share the same address space and other resources `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`any alteration of a resource by one thread affects the other threads in the same process `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`In general, the techniques used for thread sync are the same as those for process sync.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"types-of-threads"}}>{`Types of Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`User Level Thread (ULT)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Kernel Level Thread (KLT) `}<MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`also called kernel-supported threads or lightweight threads`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"user-level-threads"}}>{`User-Level Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Thread management all done by application.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Multithreading is managed by a runtime threads lib `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The kernel is not aware of the existence of threads `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Only schedule the process as a unit and assigns a single execution state to that process `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"disadvantages-of-ult"}}>{`Disadvantages of ULT`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`In a typical OS many system calls are blocking `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`as a result, when a ULT executes a system call, not only is the thread blocked, but all within the process are blocked `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`In a pure ULT strategy, multithreaded applications cannot take advantage of multiprocessing.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"kernel-level-threads"}}>{`Kernel-Level Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Kernel maintains context information for the process and the threads. `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`No thread management done by application `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Scheduling is done on a thread basis.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Windows is an example of this approach.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"advantages-of-klt"}}>{`Advantages of KLT`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The kernel can simultaneously schedule multiple threads from the same process on multiple processors.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If one thread is blocked, the kernel schedules another thread of the same process.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Kernel routines themselves can be multithreaded.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"multicore--multithreading"}}>{`Multicore & Multithreading`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Achieves concurrency without the overhead of using multiple processes.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Threads within the same process can exchange information through their common address space and have access to the shared resources of the process.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Threads of any process can run on any processor`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Soft affinity:
- dispatcher tries to assign a ready thread to the same processor it last ran on
- helps reuse data still in that processor's memory caches from the previous execution of the thread `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Hard affinity:
- an application restricts thread execution to certain processors`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"multicore-challenges"}}>{`Multicore Challenges`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Dividing activities `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Balance `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Data splitting `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Data dependency `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Testing and debugging `}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"linux-threads"}}>{`Linux Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Linux uses the same internal representation for processes and threads; a thread is simply a new process (or task) that happens to share the same address space as its parent.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`A distinction is only made when a new thread is created by the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`clone`}</MDXTag>{` system call
- `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`fork`}</MDXTag>{` creates a new process with its own entirely new process context
- `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`clone`}</MDXTag>{` creates a new process with its own identity, but that is allowed to share the data structures of its parent`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Using `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`clone`}</MDXTag>{` gives the application fine-grained control over exactly what is shared between two threads.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="table" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="thead" components={components} parentName="table">
<MDXTag name="tr" components={components} parentName="thead">
<MDXTag name="th" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}>{`flag`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="th" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}>{`meaning`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="tbody" components={components} parentName="table">
<MDXTag name="tr" components={components} parentName="tbody">
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="td">{`CLONE_FS`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}>{`File-system info is shared`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="tr" components={components} parentName="tbody">
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="td">{`CLONE_VM`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}>{`The same mem space is shared`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="tr" components={components} parentName="tbody">
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="td">{`CLONE_SIGHAND`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}>{`Signal handlers are shared`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="tr" components={components} parentName="tbody">
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="td">{`CLONE_FILES`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="td" components={components} parentName="tr" props={{"align":null}}>{`The set of open files are shared`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"windows-threads"}}>{`Windows Threads`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Processes and servies provided by the Windows Kernel are relatively simple and general purpose.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`implemented as objects `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`created as new process or a copy of an existing process `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`exec proc may contain one or more threads `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`both procs and thread objects have built-in sync capabilities`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Windows makes use of two types of process-related objects:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`Processes`}</MDXTag>{`
 an entity corresponding to a user job or application that owns resources`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`Threads`}</MDXTag>{`
 a dispatchable unit of work that executes sequentially and is interruptible`}</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
